intro: Chisocheton sumatranus, commonly known as the Sumatran chisocheton, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
